metadata.name: The Builder #01
metadata.description:
Deep down we all know  
none of us know what’s coming.  
We pretend, yes, we pretend  
we all know where we’re going.  
But from our boots,  
those hidden truths  
reveal their inner meanings  
of just how frightening it can be to know  
that we cannot ever fully know  
how another’s boots are fitting.

I like to think you can find life in everything.  
And for me the harder riddle to decipher  
is why it came to be.  
But lately, I figure  
as long as I’m here,  
I might as well enjoy the scenery —  
take in all the journey has to show,  
perhaps find out some answers down below,  
and all the while keep on questioning.

And how is it we’ve forgotten  
we all navigate this world through a lens?  
When I speak up I’m disruptive,  
and when I’m silent I’m enabling a mess.  
And if I’m honest,  
what worries me more  
than history’s dictators and corrupt presidents  
is the notion that somewhere along the line,  
despite our connectivity,  
we’ve lost our ability  
to connect.

And I finally figured out  
I can’t control  
what you think of me,  
so I’ll stop trying —  
cash out all my poker chips and go,  
build myself a mountain worth climbing.

Sometimes I catch myself  
trying to make predictions.  
Turns out half the time I’m wrong,  
but half the time I’m right, so I go with it.  
‘Cause even if/when,  
in the end,  
the world has fallen to pieces,  
well at least I’ll know I tried to grow,  
see what lies beyond the open road,  
and our current vision.

And I finally figured out  
I can’t control  
what you think of me,  
so I’ll stop trying —  
cash out all my poker chips and go,  
build myself a mountain worth climbing.

Cash out all my poker chips and go,  
build myself a mountain worth climbing,  
build myself a mountain worth climbing,  
build myself a mountain worth climbing.

------------  
The Builder  
Music & Lyrics by Mike Bass  
Copyright © 2022

------------  
Collectors of this NFT may also receive the WAV and MP3 files of The Builder, along with a 3000 x 3000 pixel JPG of the artwork if interested. Just DM or email me!
